page.title: 03Recent History of Herm.
page.content: In 1946 Herm was bought from the English Crown for Â£15,000 by the States of Guernsey. The guiding principle in the control to be exercised by the States of Guernsey was "That the natural attractions and peacefulness of the island are preserved, and are made available to all who visit it." In 1949 Major & Mrs. Peter Wood took over the tenancy of the island and now have a lease which will run until 2029. The Wood family have developed the island as a thriving community based on farming and tourism, while preserving the "natural attractions and peacefulness of the island."
